description: Add Only Flag. Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Academic_PeriodObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Academic_PeriodObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Academic_PeriodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: Standard Start Date is required for Standard Academic Periods.
Enter a Start Date on or after Standard Start Date.
Cannot set Standard Start Date for a non-Standard Academic Period.
The End Date of the Period cannot be after the Standard End Date.
Standard End Date is required for Standard Academic Periods.
Cannot set Standard End Date for a non-Standard Academic Period.

Maintained_Academic_Period_Data.description: Wrapper element for the Maintained Academic Period data.

description: Wrapper element for the Maintained Academic Period data.

validation.validation: End Date is before Start Date.
Standard Academic Period Start Date is not editable.
Standard Academic Period End Date is not editable.
Academic periods that belong to an academic calendar must have a Period Type reference.
When you have a Period Type reference for an academic period, you must have an academic calendar reference.
You can't add or change the period type for an existing academic period.
To specify date controls for an academic period, use the Put Academic Period Date Controls web service instead.

To change the Academic Period Start Date or Academic Period End Date, access the Edit Academic Period Dates task. You can only use this web service to change the dates when the academic period doesn't contain transactional data. The academic period currently contains: [apr] [payments] [charges] [pre] [post] [course]
